problem.p: A time \(t_0\) a bowling ball of mass \(m\) and radius \(R\) is thrown down an alley with an initial speed \(v_0\) and no spin. At a given instant of time \(t_f\) the ball starts to roll without slipping.
During the time interval \(t_0 \le t \le t_f\), while the ball is slipping and rolling :
A. The net torque about the center of mass of the ball is zero.
B. The net torque about point Q on the surface is zero. (Point Q is on the straight line described by the point of contact between the ball and the surface).
C. The magnitude of the acceleration of the center of mass, \(a_{cm}\) and the magnitude of the angular acceleration \(\alpha\) are such that \(a_{cm}=\alpha R\).
D. The velocity of the center of mass of the ball is constant.
E. The acceleration of the center of mass of the ball is constant.

optionresponse.p: Which of the statements listed above are correct?
